Enhanced periodicity testing using multiple spectral methods

Source: R/discriminant_tests.R
test_periodicity.Rd

Performs comprehensive periodicity and pattern detection using multiple statistical tests including Fisher's g-test, Bartels rank test, Cox-Stuart test, turning points test, and Ljung-Box test.

Usage

test_periodicity(samples)

Arguments

samples

Numeric vector of random samples to test

Value

A list containing comprehensive periodicity test results:

test_name

Name of the test suite

fisher_g_stat

Fisher's g-statistic for hidden periodicities

fisher_p_value

P-value from Fisher's g-test

bartels_p_value

P-value from Bartels rank test

cox_stuart_p_value

P-value from Cox-Stuart trend test

turning_points_p_value

P-value from turning points test

ljung_box_p_value

P-value from Ljung-Box test

combined_p_value

Mean of all valid p-values

passed

Logical; TRUE if majority of tests pass

tests_passed

String showing number of tests passed

interpretation

Human-readable interpretation

Details

The function combines multiple tests to detect various types of patterns:

  • Fisher's g-test: Detects hidden periodicities in the frequency domain

  • Bartels rank test: Tests for randomness using rank-based methods

  • Cox-Stuart test: Detects monotonic trends

  • Turning points test: Analyzes local extrema patterns

  • Ljung-Box test: Tests for serial correlation up to lag 20

The overall assessment passes if the majority of individual tests pass (p-value > 0.05). This ensemble approach provides robust detection of various non-random patterns.

Note

Some tests may fail with NA p-values if the sample size is too small or if required packages are not available. The overall assessment uses only valid test results.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Test for periodicity
samples <- runif(5000)
result <- test_periodicity(samples)
print(result$interpretation)
} # }
